product_specification.In The Box: Handset, Charger, Earphone, Quick Start Guide
product_specification.Supported Languages: English, Hindi, Gujarati, Punjabi, Tamil, Telugu, Bengali, Kannada and Malayalam
product_specification.Other Features: Dual 4G VoLTE Enabled, Wi-Fi, HotSpot Tethering
product_specification.Warranty Summary: 1 Year Warranty, 100 Days Replacement within 1 Year of Phone Warranty, 6 Months on Accessories and One time Screen Replacement within 365 Days.

product_description.Quick Connectivity: This phone comes with the Wi-Fi hotspot feature which allows you to share the network connection with up to eight other devices, enabling you to create your own Wi-Fi network at home or while traveling. All you need to do is, long-press the ‘Central key’ on the phone to activate the ‘Hotspot’ functionality.
product_description.High-speed Internet: This phone supports 4G network, enabling you to enjoy crystal-clear VoLTE HD call quality, fast Web browsing, and a smooth social-media experience. It can also be connected to your home Wi-Fi router, so you can enjoy a fast and reliable Internet connection.
product_description.Kingvoice Feature: By long pressing the ‘0’ key on this phone, you can activate the Kingvoice functionality so that it can read out the menu, submenu, time, SMS, and more. You can access this feature in English or Hindi, according to your preference.
product_description.Stunning Design: Featuring a stylish, compact, and 3D-curved design, this phone from Itel helps you look trendy and fashionable. Its 6.1 cm (2.4) QVGA display helps you view every bit of content clearly.
product_description.Capture Photos: Equipped with a 1.3 MP rear camera, with flash, this Itel phone allows you to capture special moments with ease.
product_description.Long-lasting Battery Life: With a large 1900 mAh Li-ion battery, this phone offers you a talktime of about 30 hours on a single full charge. It also offers a standby time of up to 24 days, making it a must-have device for everyone.

Review after 2 days of usage...

1. Form factor / Looks / Build Quality - Look wise phone is absolutely stunner. Very polished and properly finished product. Colours are glossy. Feels little slippery in hand. But thats OK.


2. Usability - performance wise is good.. buttons are little hard. I didn't like keypad very much but its decent and does the job.

3. Screen - cant expect much. But it is well enough in this price range.

4. Features and Performance: Frankly speaking, i bought this phone to avoid the wastage of money in wifi hot spots or any external FTTH connections. This phone is a great deal for those who are looking for a 4g volte phone with hotspot in their budget. I got this in 2199. I did an endurance testing of battery and results were beyond my expectations. Really impressed me a lot in this department.
In this test , I used two airtel 4g sims with 32 gb memory card with hotspot and bluetooth headset connected. Started testing in 2.45PM noon and this phone was standing till 11.30pm which is almost 9hrs.. Amazing !!!! I was expecting not more than 4-5 hrs.. But next day , that is today, I started same test again but this time its single data only sim with hotspot only.. I started this in today morning around 9am and its still on and has 47% battery left. Attaching image.

5. Battery - Its almost 1800mah but is good enough for normal stand by.. Even with hotspot or wifi on you can have a day easily.

6. Charging - Bit disappointed in this department. I use Mi 2i powerbank to charge and it takes 4-5 hours to charge fully. I havent tried with any other brand normal charger or fast charger, or even with its own oem charger. I have Oppo 30Watt fast charger with normal 10W chargers along with 5w-18Watt power bank.. i will try with other chargers and let you guys know.

7. Call quality is good enough. Loudspeakers arent much loud but yes they are good. Ringtones too are moderate and pleasant to ears.

8. Connectivity : you have all commonly used connectivity options in this phone.. Dual Volte 4G , Bluetooth, Wifi, and Hotspot. One thing I would like to share and that is, although its bluetooth is v4.2 but its range very nice.. I have Oppo F9 Pro which looses BT after 15 -20 feets but this phone works even beyond 20-25feets.

9. Camera -E cant expect anything..



Finally, this phone reminds me of year 2002 when I bought nokia 6600. This phone made me nostalgic...


Anyways, wrapping.. This is a review of brand new phone.. i will keep on updating this review every two - three months.. Fingers crossed .. nd hope for the best..

But for now.. Kudos to ITel

I bought thus phone in exchange with nokia 8110 banana phone which was a jio phone in nokia skin and was not at all functioning despite expensive price tag. Nokia used to be really very good before they sold their business. Their symbian OS was really good. I still have nokia 5310 which is still functioning but due to battery unavailability unable to use it. To replace this i bought banana phone with kai OS which is very slow and buggy. So bought this one in exchange of banana. I was surprised and impressed when i started using this phone. The software is really good. All the features are working. Customizations work. There is no lag in operation its quick and smooth. Wifi hotspot works. HD calls are loud enough and clear. Battery backup is good. Looks and color is also good. Display is sharp and clear. But do not expect dslr quality image from camera. This is not a camera phone. I've seen ppl cribbing for camera clarity. Wireless fm is good. Internal memory is enough only for contacts and smses but can be expanded by adding memory card. Overall this can close nokia's feature phone industry again which is palgued by slow buggy software and expensive phones.

I bought this phone for using it as a calling device and for the wifi hotspot. It does this pretty effectively. It lasts around 7-9 hours of hotspot only use. And if almost idle (with infrequent calls) it can stay upto 2 and a half days and even more.

However I have used itel feature phones before and i can assure you this is not their best.
You see, itel phones in my opinion are the only ones which can make your life much more easier with things like "make your custom music list and reach it directly with one click", "being able to install java apps", "being fast cause its a feature phone"etc. Having simple things like these ultimately decide if a phone is good or bad.
This phone doesn't have these kind of things.
It does a however support mp4 and 3gp videos in mid resolutions i.e. around 480p. But then again, viewing angles matter a lot. It contains a ebook reader which pretty good but then again only txt format and html is available.
The camera is excellent for a feature phone. It almost gave a budget smartphone like quality. Data connection depends on your location and other factors, but no technical issues faced.
Finally, this is a good phone for calls and hotspot.

If you travel in the interiors of India, there will be many places where your primary sim doesn't have network. There will be many places where you have only BSNL. Many paces where you have Jio in addition to BSNL. If you want an additional phone for such visits but don't want to lug around an expensive and large smartphone, it's best to have a 4G enabled feature phone as Jio wouldn't work on a 2G phone. Also one of the best kept secrets about BSNL is that it's providing 4G services in many interior locations (why it doesn't do so in metros and big towns is anyone's guess) and if the feature phone isn't 4G enabled, you will not be able to make use of that. And if you are going to need whatsapp and email on your main phone or a laptop, you need the second phone to function as a Wifi Hotspot. The Itel Magic ticks all boxes. For about the price of a wifi dongle, you get a feature phone that doubles up as a wifi hotspot. The phone doesn't have whasapp but you can continue using the wahtsapp on your main phone by connecting it to the hotspot. When one looks at the lternatives, there is simply no other 4 enabled feature phone with hotspot function at even double the price of the Itel Magic 4G. The phone has excellent battery life too and I like the looks of it as well as the convenience - you can put it in your trouser pocket and won't even notice that it's there. All in all an excellent innovative product.

First of all don't mix the review with overall rating that I have given to itel magic2 4g.. i.e. 5star as the product deserves 5* no matter what review talks about. My purpose of review is just to share what I could have wished more from product and there are only pros that one can see in the price v/s utility of this product. Go for it without even reading below you won't regret your choice if your prime use is basic calling and to have carrier independent hotspot

1. Camera - didn't click single photo yet but vga resolutions are not to be tested these days.
2. UI comfort- nice user friendly considering that it is keypad phone. Messaging could have had emojis but not a prime concern.
3. Features - with Bluetooth I cannot answer from Bluetooth that let me down a little. Wish there could have been an update feature like nokia 215 4g but this is outstanding nokia without update as well.
4. Sound - speaker is typical feature phone speaker which distorts over 60% volume.
5. Connectivity - true 4g speed you get on hotspot and hotspot offers you device restriction features as well to allow only whitelisted devices to use hotspot. Wish browser could have supported java script but that is too much of ask I would say from product at this price. Mind you it has dual VoLTE dual standby. I wish it could have given option to select default calling sim selection feature which is why I have to press calling button twice each time I have to make call.
6. Battery - so far without hotspot it went well around 3 days with average calling of 30mins daily. With hotspot I could download close to 1gb with 60% battery so yes it drains battery if hotspot is something that you are going to use more. My office work consumes 1.5gb of daily use which I think it can last woth full charge.

All in all go for it as you are still reading this review. Itel Magic2 4g costs same as other hotspot devices also cost this much and this one is carrier independent and can serve as hotspot for any sim that you may have
